Bing Maps iOS Control Documentation

Bing Maps iOS Control

The Bing Maps iOS Control is an Objective-C control for embedding maps directly into native iOS apps. With a rich, gesture-based UI provided by Seadragon, the Bing Maps iOS Control provides support for adding pushpins and other overlays to the map, allows your device location to be displayed, and provides the ability to retrieve contextual information for a given map location.

Getting Started with the Bing Maps iOS Control

Before you being using the Bing Maps iOS Control, you need to get a Bing Maps Key to authenticate your iOS app. To obtain a Bing Maps Key, go to the Bing Maps Account Center and create a Bing Maps Account. This is described in the Creating a Bing Maps Account and Getting a Bing Maps Key topics. Information about using your Bing Maps Key in your app is found in the Adding your Bing Maps Key topic in this SDK.

Installation Files

The Bing Maps iOS Control SDK includes the following:

  • A readme.html file.
  • The Bing Maps iOS Control (as a universal static library) plus the required resources bundle and header files, found in the MapControl folder.
  • Sample Xcode projects, found in the Samples folder.
  • API reference documentation for the Bing Maps iOS Control, as HTML files in the Docs folder.
